sys_embedded_help_content.content:
Add or modify an HR task template

  1. Add or edit the HR task template fields.
    FieldDescription
    Owning GroupThe group responsible for the HR template. Examples: HR, IT, Facilities. Owning groups are defined in the Manage Owner Groups in the Lifecycle Events module.
    HR task type
    • HR Service: The HR Service field appears. Select an HR Service related to the HR task type.
    • Submit Catalog Item: Catalog Item appears when Type is Submit Catalog Item. Notify the user to select equipment or other items for an employee.
    • Submit Order Guide: Order Guide appears when Submit Order Guide is selected. Requests the person assigned to the task to select an order guide. An example is a hiring manager requesting a new employee to select items like hardware and software as part of the onboarding process.
    • Checklist: The Checklist items field appears. Enter checklist items.
    • Credential: The Acknowledgement document field appears. Select a document (PDF Template) that the user acknowledges by entering a password.
    • E-Signature: Send a document (PDF Template) that the user acknowledges by entering an e-signature.
    • Mark When Complete: Notify the user a Completed button appears on the HR Service Portal. Use the Short description to provide details about this task.
      Note: Mark When Complete changes the state of the task to Closed Complete.
    • Sign Document: Requests the Subject person to edit or sign a document. An example is sending an education agreement to be signed for tuition reimbursement.

      Select a document from the PDF Template and enter a short description.

      Note: After the user signs the document, the document is generated with the signature and attached to the task. The task is closed complete and the document is attached to the case.
    • Take Survey: The Survey field appears. Select a survey to request the person assigned to the task to take a survey.
    • Upload Documents: Requests the person assigned to the task to upload documents. Examples are receipts, course registration, or transcripts for tuition reimbursement. Use the Short description field to provide instructions.
      Note: The task must be in Ready or Work in Progress.
    • URL: The URL field appears. Enter a URL link that the user acknowledges when accessed.
    • View Video: The URL field appears. Requests the person assigned to the task to view a video.
    Assignment typeDetermines the HR agent or group the HR case or task is assigned to. Depending on what is selected, additional fields appear to further define who the task is assigned to.
    • Employee
      • Parent case subject person: Assign the task to the Subject person on the parent case.
      • Parent case opened for: Assign the task to the Opened for person on the parent case.
      • User from case: The Parent case table field appears when checked. Select the table (defaults to HR Case) and user to assign the task.
      • Named user: The Assigned to field appears when checked. Select the user to assign the task.
    • Fulfiller
      • Parent case assigned to: Check to assign the task to the person the parent case is assigned to.
      • Named user: The Assigned to field appears. Select a specific user to assign the task.
      • User from case: The Parent case table and Assigned to appear. Select the table and the specific user from the table to assign the task.
      • Skills/Assignment group: The Parent case table, Skills, and Assignment Group appear. Select the table and the specific user from the table to assign the task.
    Due DateSelect how the due date is based on:
    • Based on task assignment date: Use the date the HR case was assigned to determine due date.
      Note: The Select Date link is not visible or available to use. Also, the Date offset type defaults to After.
    • Based on parent case table: Use a field on the HR parent case to determine due date.
    Due date calculationEnter the offset value.
    For example, select/enter:
    • Due Date = Parent case table
    • Date offset quantity = 5
    • Date offset units = Days
    • After
    • Select Date = Actual start
    These entries define a due date of five days before the actual start date of the task.
    StateThe default work status of the task when it first opens. The states are:
    • Draft
    • Ready
    • Work in Progress
    • Closed Complete
    • Closed Incomplete
    • Cancelled
    • Suspended
      Note: Change the state to Ready or Work in Progress for the employee to see the task that you created.
    Task support teamSelect who supports the employee for this task. You can select specific users and/or groups or Queue.

    When you select Queue, you can select a specific chat queue from the Queue field.

    Users from parent caseAppears when Users and groups is selected from Task support team.

    Assign users as a support team for the HR task.

    GroupsAppears when Users and groups is selected from Task support team.

    Assign groups as a support team for the HR task.

    Set reminderAppears when the Due date calculation fields are used.

    Check to send an email notification based on the Due date calculation entries.

    Reminder templateAppears when the Due date calculations fields are used.

    Select the email template used for reminder notifications. Email templates are set up from HR Administration > Email Content.

    When to send (days)Appears when the Due date calculations fields are used.

    Enter the number of days before the task due date to send the reminder email.

    Interval (days)Appears when the Due date calculations fields are used.

    Enter the number of days the reminder email should be sent on intervals.

    For example, entering a 5 indicates that the reminder notification is sent every 5 days until the due date is reached.

  2. Click Submit, Save, or Update.
